title: Improve bootstrap completion message with tiered display
description: Redesign the bootstrap completion output to use tiered information display. Show only the most important immediate next step first, then provide optional detailed information on request. This reduces information overload (current: 20-30 lines) and makes the next action crystal clear. Include estimated time for next steps.
notes: HIGH IMPACT - Phase 1 Quick Win. COMPLETED: Redesigned bootstrap completion message in smart-bootstrap.md (lines 735-936) with tiered information architecture. Tier 1 (Essential): Shows only immediate next step in 10-12 lines with time estimates, project name, template, and one clear action. Tier 2 (Detailed): Full configuration, file list, detailed next steps, time estimates - shown only on request ('show details'). Includes 3 complete examples showing Phase 0, Research, and Life Projects outputs. Benefits: Reduces cognitive load from 30+ lines to 10-12, prevents decision paralysis, makes next action crystal clear, keeps details available when needed. Addresses 'Post-Bootstrap Guidance Overload' pain point.
user_benefit: Users know exactly what to do next without being overwhelmed by information, reducing decision paralysis
